By car because there is no bus around the city; walk in the center of the town beside the bridge; rent a sailboat to see the huge bay of Gaspé; rent a horse in the park if you like.

value: Close-up of waterfall along the "La Chute" hiking trail, Forillon National Park
hours=Peak season (June 1-October 31): 9AM-5PM every day; Regular season (November 1-May 31):Closed on Monday, Tuesday-Friday: 10AM-5PM, Saturday and Sunday: 1PM-5PM

price=Adult: $10, Student 18 years and over: $8, Senior 65 years and over: $8, Family 1 adult, 1 child: $12, Family 1 adult, 2 children: $17, Family 2 adults, 1 child: $21, Family 2 adults, 2 children: $25, Child 5 and under: free, Child 6 to 17 years: $5, Group (20 people or more): $5/pers., School group: $2/pers.

content=According to the museum's website, two of its goals are to "[s]pread knowledge and foster an appreciation of the history and heritage of the Gaspé" and "[s]tudy and teach others about the cultural diversity of the Gaspé."

hours=High season: Toll booth (from June 1st to October 14); Interpretation Centre (from June 1st to October 14); Visitor Centre (from June 21 to September 2nd). Off season Forillon National Park access
(October 9, 2012 – May 18, 2013): Service buildings are closed and trails and infrastructures are unmaintained. Access to the Forillon National Park is possible all year round, but you are responsible for your own safety.

price=Daily: Adult: $7.80; Senior $6.80; Youth: $3.90 Family/Group: $19.60; Commercial Group, per person $6.80; School Groups, per student $2.90. Includes entry to Grande-Grave Heritage Site. Daily Entry (Reduced Level of Service - Before June 25 and after Labour Day): Adult $5.65; Senior: $4.90; Youth $2.90; Family/Group $13.70; School Groups, per student: $1.90

content=Hotel in center of town.  Near post office. Restaurant on premises. Autobus Orleans Express has a ticket agency in the reception counter of Hotel.
